etymologies: mid 19th century. From scientific Latin Hapalotis, former genus name from ancient Greek ἁπαλός soft (of unknown origin) + οὐτ-, οὖς ear

definitions: Any of various long-eared, long-tailed Australian rodents of the former genus Hapalotis (family Muridae), now placed in the genera Notomys (hopping mice) and Conilurus (rabbit rats).

notes.text: Half of the dozen or so recorded species became extinct during the 19th and early 20th centuries.
